titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Murphy, curator, and Audrey Spainhower, student manuscript processor

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-09-13T09:11-0600

arrangement.p: Arranged by material topic in groupings described by Norma Frost.

appraisal.p: LDS, Utah, and Western American Women (20th Century Western and Mormon Manuscripts collection development policy 5.V, August 2007). Norma Frost attended BYU and included in the collection are photographs and a cookbook from her BYU ward.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Norma Frost was born in Massachusetts but lived most of her life in Delaware. She loves the Eastern United States and the church history sites in New York State. She attended Brigham Young University beginning in 1968. She is a member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and enjoys serving as a relief society teacher.

userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the researcher to obtain any necessary copyright clearances. Permission to publish material from Norma Frost collection must be obtained from the Supervisor of Reference Services and/or the L. Tom Perry Special Collections Board of Curators.

prefercite.p: Initial citation: MSS 7604; Norma Frost Collection; 20th-21st Century Western and Mormon Manuscripts; L. Tom Perry Special Collections, Harold B. Lee Library, Brigham Young University. Following citations: MSS 7604, LTPSC.

processinfo.p: Audrey Spainhower, student manuscript processor, and John Murphy, curator; 2010.

scopecontent.p: Contains various items that tell the story of Norma Frostâ€™s life and priorities. The items are artifacts and photographs that represent different periods in her life, including her days at BYU, the Hill Cumorah pageant, her pilgrim and Delaware heritage, and her time as a Relief Society teacher. Materials date between 1940 and 2007.
